result.execSummary:
The defendant Oliver Darren Pierson was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Burglary-Building or Dwelling, a class F felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.10(1m)(a).
  • Resisting or Obstructing an Officer, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.41(1).
  • Theft-Movable Property <=$2500, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 943.20(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Oliver Darren Pierson

records.descr: Notice and acknowledge of def voting ineligibility

records.addlTxt:
8:44 AM Defendant Oliver Darren Pierson in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Oliver Darren Pierson.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Court calls case. State indicates defendant will plead to Counts 1, 3 and 4. Remaining count dismissed but read in. Sentence withheld for 2 years, concurrent probation, 28 days, 28 days credit, DOC programming, costs, restitution of $110.65, continuation of no contact order. 
Court recounts charges and possible penalties. Defendant pleads no contest. Court informs defendant of rights given up by their plea. Attorney stipulates to a factual basis. Court accepts the Defendant's plea and finds that the Defendant's plea has been freely, voluntarily and intelligently made. Court finds Defendant understands all the rights they are waiving by their plea. The Defendant is found guilty and Judgment of Conviction is entered. Count 2 is dismissed but read in. 
Court orders sentence withheld for 2 years on all counts, concurrent probation on each count with concurrent conditions, 28 days, 28 credit, DOC programming, mandatory court costs, restitution of $110.65, bail to apply, continued no contact conditions, 120 days to pay balance.

8:35 AM Defendant Oliver Darren Pierson in court.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Oliver Darren Pierson.  Attorney Angela Wilson for Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nelsen notes offer was made and State was still waiting on documentation and asks for another status conference. Court sets status conference.
Status conference scheduled for June 27, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Status conference on June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.

8:26 AM Defendant Oliver Darren Pierson appeared by phone.  Attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen in court for Oliver Darren Pierson.  Attorney Mark Adam Fruehauf in court for State of Wisconsin. Attorney Nelsen received information, waives reading and pleads not guilty. Court accepts not guilty plea. Attorney Nelsen notes inpt treatment right now and asks for status after treatment is completed. Defendant states 42-60 days inpatient. Clerk to send notice to inpt treatment center.
Status conference scheduled for June 6, 2022 at 08:30 am.
State's Demand for Discovery and Inspection

records.addlTxt: 09:25 AM Defendant Oliver Darren Pierson in court with attorney Lance Morgan Nelsen via zoom.  Defendant Oliver Darren Pierson in custody.  Mark Adam Fruehauf appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney-Client waives preliminary hearing.  Court finds waiver knowing/voluntary; finds probable cause that a felony was committed and binds over for arraignment.  Court reminds of bail/conditions.  Arraignment scheduled for March 28, 2022 at 08:30 am.
Defendant's Demand for Discovery and Inspection
records.descr: Demand for Discovery and Inspection - Defendant

records.addlTxt: No contact with Manions Truss or Conrad Brown or 2102 John Ave in Superior.

01:29 PM Defendant Oliver Darren Pierson in court with attorney Ellen Denise Craker.  Defendant Oliver Darren Pierson in custody.  Chad C La Lor appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Oliver Darren Pierson appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant's address confirmed.  Attorney/defendant acknowledges receipt of criminal complaint, waives reading enter not guilty on misdemeanor and set for PH on felony. Atty Craker indicates she did not receive an ID Key. State indicates there doesn't need to be one and Court disagrees. Atty Craker would like to have an ID Key. State does not have any legal basis to back it up right now.  Court indicates there is an indication of victim 1 and victim 2. States request on bail:  $750 cash bail with conditions of No contact with a Conrad Brown or the address, no contact with Manions Truss. State gives prior criminal history. Atty Craker argues bail request and asks for recognizance bond. There are no missed court appearances. Does have family in the area. Does have employment in the area. Defendant is not able to post any money.
Court  has concerns of the allegations against him. Defendant doesn't have contact with Douglas County or any other Wisconsin areas. Court Orders $500 cash bail with conditions of No contact with Manions Truss or Conrad Brown or 2102 John Ave in Superior. 
Defendant does qualify.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for February 23, 2022 at 09:30 am.
